enumerations.name: DataTransformationKindEnum
enumerations.note: This enumeration contributes to the definition of the scope of the DataTransformation. Aggregated by DataTransformation.dataTransformationKind

literals.name: asymmetricFrom
literals.description:
The DataTransformation shall only be applied to the receiving end only, i.e. transform from byte array ByteArray to data type.
Tags: atp.EnumerationLiteralIndex=0

literals.name: asymmetricToByteArray
literals.description:
The DataTransformation shall be applied to the sending end only, i.e. from data type to byte array.
Tags: atp.EnumerationLiteralIndex=1

literals.name: symmetric
literals.description:
The DataTransformation shall be applied at both the sending and the receiving end of the
Tags: atp.EnumerationLiteralIndex=2

enumerations.name: TransformerClassEnum
enumerations.note: Specifies the transformer class of a transformer. Aggregated by TransformationTechnology.transformerClass

literals.name: custom
literals.description:
The transformer is a custom transformer.
Tags: atp.EnumerationLiteralIndex=0

literals.name: safety
literals.description:
The transformer is a safety transformer.
Tags: atp.EnumerationLiteralIndex=1

literals.name: security
literals.description:
The transformer is a security transformer.
Tags: atp.EnumerationLiteralIndex=2

literals.name: serializer
literals.description:
The transformer is a serializing transformer.
Tags: atp.EnumerationLiteralIndex=3

enumerations.name: CSTransformerErrorReactionEnum
enumerations.note: Possible kinds of error reaction in case of a hard transformer error. Aggregated by TransformationISignalProps.csErrorReaction

literals.name: applicationOnly
literals.description:
The application is responsible for any error reaction. No autonomous error reaction of RTE and
Tags: atp.EnumerationLiteralIndex=0

literals.name: autonomous
literals.description:
RTE and Transformer coordinate an autonomous error reaction on their own.
Tags: atp.EnumerationLiteralIndex=1

enumerations.name: SOMEIPMessageTypeEnum
enumerations.note: Depending on the style of the communication different message types shall be set in the header of a SOME/IP message. Aggregated by SOMEIPTransformationISignalProps.messageType

literals.name: notification
literals.description:
A request of a notification expecting no response.
Tags: atp.EnumerationLiteralIndex=1

literals.name: request
literals.description:
A request expecting a response.
Tags: atp.EnumerationLiteralIndex=2

enumerations.name: DataIdModeEnum
enumerations.note: Supported inclusion modes to include the implicit two-byte Data ID in the one-byte CRC. Aggregated by E2EProfileConfiguration.dataIdMode, EndToEndTransformationDescription.dataIdMode

literals.name: all16Bit
literals.description:
Two bytes are included in the CRC (double ID configuration).
Tags: atp.EnumerationLiteralIndex=0

literals.name: alternating8Bitcounter
literals.description:
One of the two bytes byte is included, alternating high and low byte, depending on parity of the high byte is included.
Tags: atp.EnumerationLiteralIndex=1

literals.name: lower12Bit
literals.description:
The low byte is included in the implicit CRC calculation, the low nibble of the high byte is transmitted along with the data (i.e. it is explicitly included), the high nibble of the high byte is not used. This is applicable for the IDs up to 12 bits.
Tags: atp.EnumerationLiteralIndex=2

literals.name: lower8Bitare
literals.description:
Only low byte is included, high byte is never used. This is applicable if the IDs in a particular system
Tags: atp.EnumerationLiteralIndex=3

enumerations.name: EndToEndProfileBehaviorEnum
enumerations.note: Behavior of the check functionality Aggregated by EndToEndTransformationDescription.profileBehavior

literals.name: PRE_R4_2
literals.description:
Check has the legacy behavior, before AUTOSAR Release 4.2.
Tags: atp.EnumerationLiteralIndex=0, xml.name=PRE–R-4–2

literals.name: R4_2
literals.description:
Check behaves like new P4/P5/P6 profiles introduced in AUTOSAR Release 4.2.
Tags: atp.EnumerationLiteralIndex=1, xml.name=R-4–2
